00025 #include <stdio.h>
00026 #include <string.h>
00027 
00028 struct {
00029    char c;
00030    double d;
00031 } test_align;
00032 
00033 #ifdef vxw
00034 hwtest()
00035 #else
00036 main()
00037 #endif
00038 {
00039    unsigned long dummy;
00040    unsigned char *p;
00041    float f;
00042    double d;
00043    int i;
00044 
00045    printf("Data sizes:\n");
00046    printf("sizeof(int)    = %d\n", sizeof(int));
00047    printf("sizeof(float)  = %d\n", sizeof(float));
00048    printf("sizeof(double) = %d\n", sizeof(double));
00049    printf("sizeof(long int) = %d\n", sizeof(long int));
00050    printf("sizeof(long double) = %d\n", sizeof(long double));
00051    printf("sizeof(char *) = %d\n", sizeof(p));
00052    if (sizeof(p) == 2)
00053       printf("...this looks like a 16-bit OS\n\n");
00054    else if (sizeof(p) == 4)
00055       printf("...this looks like a 32-bit OS\n\n");
00056    else if (sizeof(p) == 8)
00057       printf("...this looks like a 64-bit OS\n\n");
00058 
00059    printf("Byte order:\n");
00060    dummy = 0x12345678;
00061    p = (unsigned char *) &dummy;
00062    printf("0x12345678     = %02X %02X %02X %02X\n", p[0], p[1], p[2], p[3]);
00063    if (*((unsigned char *) &dummy) == 0x78)
00064       printf("...this looks like a LITTLE ENDIAN machine\n\n");
00065    else
00066       printf("...this looks like a BIG ENDIAN machine\n\n");
00067 
00068    printf("Floating point coding:\n");
00069    f = (float) 1.2345;
00070    p = (unsigned char *) &f;
00071    printf("1.2345f        = ");
00072    for (i = 0; i < sizeof(float); i++)
00073       printf("%02X ", p[i]);
00074    printf("\n");
00075    d = 1.2345;
00076    p = (unsigned char *) &d;
00077    printf("1.2345d        = ");
00078    for (i = 0; i < sizeof(double); i++)
00079       printf("%02X ", p[i]);
00080    printf("\n");
00081 
00082    dummy = 0;
00083    memcpy(&dummy, &f, sizeof(f));
00084    if ((dummy & 0xFF) == 0x19 &&
00085        ((dummy >> 8) & 0xFF) == 0x04 &&
00086        ((dummy >> 16) & 0xFF) == 0x9E && ((dummy >> 24) & 0xFF) == 0x3F)
00087       printf("...this looks like IEEE float format\n");
00088    else if ((dummy & 0xFF) == 0x9E &&
00089             ((dummy >> 8) & 0xFF) == 0x40 &&
00090             ((dummy >> 16) & 0xFF) == 0x19 && ((dummy >> 24) & 0xFF) == 0x04)
00091       printf("...this looks like VAX float format\n");
00092 
00093    dummy = 0;
00094    memcpy(&dummy, &d, sizeof(f));
00095    if ((dummy & 0xFF) == 0x8D &&
00096        ((dummy >> 8) & 0xFF) == 0x97 &&
00097        ((dummy >> 16) & 0xFF) == 0x6E && ((dummy >> 24) & 0xFF) == 0x12)
00098       printf("...this looks like IEEE double float format (little endian)\n\n");
00099    else if ((dummy & 0xFF) == 0x83 &&
00100             ((dummy >> 8) & 0xFF) == 0xC0 &&
00101             ((dummy >> 16) & 0xFF) == 0xF3 && ((dummy >> 24) & 0xFF) == 0x3F)
00102       printf("...this looks like IEEE double float format (big endian)\n\n");
00103    else if ((dummy & 0xFF) == 0x13 &&
00104             ((dummy >> 8) & 0xFF) == 0x40 &&
00105             ((dummy >> 16) & 0xFF) == 0x83 && ((dummy >> 24) & 0xFF) == 0xC0)
00106       printf("...this looks like VAX G double format\n\n");
00107    else if ((dummy & 0xFF) == 0x9E &&
00108             ((dummy >> 8) & 0xFF) == 0x40 &&
00109             ((dummy >> 16) & 0xFF) == 0x18 && ((dummy >> 24) & 0xFF) == 0x04)
00110       printf("...this looks like VAX D double format\n\n");
00111 
00112 
00113    i = (int) (&test_align.d) - (int) &test_align.c;
00114    printf("Structure members are %d-byte aligned\n\n", i);
00115 
00116    return 1;
00117 }
